name: Dichorisandra flesheri
collectorTeam: E.H.Souza, P.L.Ribeiro, R.R.N.França, S.S. Mota, G.M.D.Ferreira, A.Caetité, G.Q.Nascimento
locality: Igrapiúna, Reserva Ecológica Michelin, Mata da Vila 5, 132 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.647.2.6 Etymology: name honours the ecologist Dr. Kevin Michael Flesher, Director of the Reserva Ecológica Michelin (REM), responsible for the conservation, and research management of the area where this new species was discovered.

name: Tradescantia insularis
distribution: Santa Catarina (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Florianópolis: Parque Municipal da Lagoa do Peri
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.458.2.2 The specific epithet refers to Santa Catarina Island, on which the only known population is located.

name: Tradescantia multibracteata
distribution: Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Júlio de Castilhos, saxícola, às margens do rio Toropi, próximo à antiga Usina de Quebra Dentes
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.308.1.7 the epithet refers to the remarkable high number of bracts in the inflorescence. From Latin multo = many, bractea = bract

name: Tradescantia schwirkowskiana
distribution: Santa Catarina (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: São Bento do Sul: Borda da ferrovia às margens do Rio Banhados
remarks: oi:10.11646/phytotaxa.272.1.3 the specific epithet is named after Paulo Schwirkowski, a notorious naturalist and plant collector from São Bento do Sul municipality, who for many years has been contributing to the knowledge of the flora of Santa Catarina

name: Tradescantia serrana
distribution: Santa Catarina (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Urubici: SC-110, entre Bom Retiro e Urubici, 1008 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.312.2.4 the specific epithet refers to the Serra Geral, a highland area in southern Brazil
